title: Desperately Searching for Travel Offers? Formulate Better Queries with Some Help from Linked Data
segmentation: Thanks for the introduction and welcome to being here for this talk about travel and entitled desperately searching for travel Office, formulate better queries with some help from Link data.
My name is true.

I'm a first year PhD student in the University, Paris, Auburn and I do research for a company named the seat badge and in this company we use Semantic Web technologies to build digital marketing solutions for E Commerce websites.
So this is a joint work with my boss.
Milan Stankovic and my supervisor Philip Yellow black.
This is the outline of my talk.
I will start by giving the background of this work, then the motivation.
After that I will present the re one system.
Then I will talk about how we did evaluation and then I will conclude the talk.
So the tourism field is today a very important field of equal mass.
According to the report Google 2013 Traveler, about 80% of people do travel planning online.
And the search is the primary entry point to travel related relation in travel related information online, about 60% of travelers always start their travel booking and planning process with search.
So in today's travel websites we can find some different kind of search tools like the search form, the search slider and the traditional search bar.
But travelers do not only use these search tools, they also use other search engines like Google, Yahoo and Bing.
According to a study conducted by Expedia, Media Solution named the Travelers Path to purchase.
Uh, so in this.
In this study there is a sample session.

In this sample session, the user went to all these websites and some others, and I cannot put every logo on my slide so we can see that this user went to different kinds of websites like travel websites, social media, websites, tourism, office, website map, website and hotel website, flight website etc.
The reason why this user went to so many different websites may be this because travelers are undecided people.
About 68% of people start searching without having a clear travel destination in mind.
They don't know where to go.
They don't know what to search and how to search.

So during a lot of time travelers are conducting, are doing something that we can call inspirational search or average travelers spent 45 days and contact the 38 visits to travel websites before purchasing.
So travelers are really spending too much time doing a lot of browsing and searching.
They gather information and do manual verifications on multiple websites there.
So on the travel websites there's no no efficient facility to support users in expressing their knees and helping them find what they want.
Our motivation is to develop an efficient search system to facilitate the travel offer.
